section.p: A vital signs observation is a simple observation that uses a specific vocabulary, and inherits constraints from CCD.

These entries are used to record current and relevant historical vital signs for the patient. Vital Signs are a subset of Results Section, but are reported in this section to follow clinical conventions.

The differentiation between Vital Signs and Results varies by clinical context. Common examples of vital signs include temperature, height, weight, blood pressure, etc. However, some clinical contexts may alter these common vitals, for example in neonatology "height" may be replaced by "crown-to-rump" measurement.

ol.li: SHALL conform to Result template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.11.83.15)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.80.62 Vital Sign Result STATIC 1 (C154-[DE-14.03-1])

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] interpretationCode (6.3.4.22.5)
The interpretation code may be present to provide an interpretation of the vital signs measure (e.g., High, Normal, Low, et cetera).

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] methodCode (6.3.4.22.6)
The method code element may be present to indicate the method used to obtain the measure. Note that method used is distinct from, but possibly related to the target site.

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] targetSiteCode (6.3.4.22.7)
The target site of the measure may be identified in the targetSiteCode element (e.g., Left arm [blood pressure], oral [temperature], et cetera).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value, where its data type is PQ (6.3.4.22.4)

SHALL satisfy: Data Element Definitions for Results [Placeholder]
Vital Signs are a subset of Results Section, but are reported in this section to follow clinical conventions.
SHALL conform to Result template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.11.83.15)
Contains exactly one [1..1] @classCode
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood) (CONF-408)
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF-409)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.80.62 Vital Sign Result STATIC 1 (C154-[DE-14.03-1])
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode (CONF-410)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] effectiveTime
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value, where its data type is PQ (6.3.4.22.4)

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] interpretationCode (6.3.4.22.5)
The interpretation code may be present to provide an interpretation of the vital signs measure (e.g., High, Normal, Low, et cetera).

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] methodCode (6.3.4.22.6)
The method code element may be present to indicate the method used to obtain the measure. Note that method used is distinct from, but possibly related to the target site.

MAY contain zero or more [0..*] targetSiteCode (6.3.4.22.7)
The target site of the measure may be identified in the targetSiteCode element (e.g., Left arm [blood pressure], oral [temperature], et cetera).

The value for 'code' SHOULD be selected from LOINC (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) or SNOMED CT (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96), and MAY be selected from CPT-4 (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.12). (CONF-413)
The methodCode SHALL NOT conflict with the method inherent in code (CONF-415)
Where value is a physical quantity, the unit of measure SHALL be expressed using a valid Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM) expression. (CONF-417)
SHOULD satisfy: Contain one or more referenceRange to show the normal range of values for the observation result (CONF-419)
SHALL NOT contain referenceRange / observationRange / code, as this attribute is not used by the HL7 Clinical Statement or Lab Committee models. (CONF-420)
SHALL satisfy: Contains one or more sources of information. (CONF-421)
Result Type SHOULD be selected from LOINC (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.1) or SNOMED CT (codeSystem 2.16.840.1.113883.6.96) (C154-[DE-15.03-1])
Result Type for laboratory results SHOULD be coded as specified in HITSP/C80 Section 2.2.3.6.1 Laboratory Observations. (C154-[DE-15.03-2])
Result Value SHALL be present when the observation/@moodCode is EVN or GOL, and SHALL NOT be present when observation/@moodCode is INT or PRP. (C83-[DE-15.05-CDA-1])

SHALL satisfy: Data Element Definitions for Results [Placeholder]
Vital Signs are a subset of Results Section, but are reported in this section to follow clinical conventions.
